content.description: 5 bolts up cool sorta loose plates direct you to a brief hand crack experience.
content.protection: 5 bolts, maybe a 2" cam for crack and 1-3" cams for gear belay.
content.location: This route is on the far west edge of the Copenhagen face, just west of Heavy Water.  Down climb over east then south through easy chimney to descend.

content.description: This is a superb steep strenuous finger crack.  It has really neat moves with good protection.
content.location: This climb is near the center of the formation, to the right of the large, left-facing dihedral of It Satisfies.

climbs.name: Limpy Grandma
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tom Burke & Andrea Tomaszewski (Gordon)

content.description: Climb the steep bolted arete on the small pinnacle across from Heavy Mettle. Avoid standing or pulling hard on loose flakes and clip the rurp for psych pro.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 2 fixed pitons and a 2-bolt rap anchor
content.location: This climb is on the "Dial-A-Pile" (aka The Danish) formation just right of Copenhagen Wall.

climbs.name: It Satisfies
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Katie Wilkinson, May, 1988

content.description: This climb has hand jams and large face holds.  It's a bit loose.
content.location: A prominent dihedral at the left end of the formation.

climbs.name: Heavy Water
climbs.fa: John Bachar and Mike Lechlinski, April 1982

content.description: This mediocre steep face and lieback has some loose rock
content.location: near the right side of the rock

content.description:
A fully equipped sport route with no offending easy section, what's not to like?  Although a couple of medium nuts are nice if you belay from just under the slab.

Thin slab leads to a short overhang with pumpy moves to the face.  Easier, but thoughtful climbing on perfect rock continues to the top.

A stellar route with two types of hard climbing, thin slab and overhung thin holds.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 2 bolt anchor with rings.  If you belay on the shelf under the initial slab, medium size nuts.
content.location:
Walk around right and down from the

Tax Man

area, passing

Butterflies are Free

which shares an anchor with this one.  Alternately, cross around the front of the wall and belay low with an easy 5th class scramble to access the route proper.

content.description:
On the east arete of Copenhagen Wall follow 5 bolts up to bolt anchor.

A sport climb - safe and fun climbing on pretty good rock, probably not a classic but better than many others.
content.location: Best accessed from IRS wall near Tax Man.
